poem:
Title: "Morning Rumination through Newsprint "

The Crunch - an indexed, 
Hyperlinked economy of words!
A specter of interest rates frolics at dawn,
while Mario Kart characters vie
for favor under an Aussie sun.

The One Big Chart bleeds binaries,
stories steeped in statistics, the world reduced
to sharp-edged integers.

Gaza weeps famine's lifelong trail,
somewhere the clock ticks into daylight saving -
How astounding, such thriving commotion
In newsprint's silent elocution.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Crunch: interest rates, daylight saving, and the best character in Mario Kart Welcome to the 12th edition of The Crunch! In this week’s newsletter we’ve got higher for longer interest rates, a deep dive into Australia’s population projections and demography, the lifelong impact of famine in Gaza, how to pick the best character in Mario Kart, and more. But first … we’re starting a new series, One Big Chart! This is a new format". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
